alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Dakota; Hennepin; Ramsey; Washington (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Hennepin, northwestern Dakota, southeastern Anoka, northern Washington and Ramsey Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 944 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles north of Lino Lakes to Fridley to Eden Prairie. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Roseville, Shoreview, New Brighton, Lino Lakes and Hugo around 950 PM CDT. St. Paul, Maplewood, Forest Lake and Vadnais Heights around 1000 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Bloomington, Apple Valley, Oakdale, White Bear Lake, Mahtomedi, Rosemount, Eagan, Inver Grove Heights, South St. Paul, West St. Paul and Stillwater. This includes Interstate 35 near mile marker 130. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for east central Minnesota.
